intro: Paederota wulfenia, commonly known as the Wulfen's bladderpod, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, erect stems and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, round seed pods that contain several seeds, typical of the mustard family. It is native to the western United States and grows in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
